page.title: 16PARISH COUNCIL & INSTITUTE
page.content: The members of the{Parish Council}are elected by the parish electorate.The members elect a chairman and appoint a non-member as clerk.The council meets in public on about ten occasions a year but few villagers attend.A typical agenda includes:Planning applications:Footpath access:The abattoir:Street lighting:Traffic speed Annual precept.The annual open meeting is very well attended by villagers & a lively discussion results. The{Social Institute}which serves as a{village hall}was built as a Primitive Methodist Chapel.There are 2 Trustees originally appointed by Miss Bates who gave the hall to the village. .It is managed by an 8 member committee who serve by invitation.It has recently been renovated & is used for the{playgroup,WEA classes,meetings & is let to groups and individuals.
